intro: Carlowrightia glandulosa, commonly known as the stickyleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its glandular leaves that produce a sticky substance, giving it its common name. It produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
